intro: Alloneuron hexamerum, commonly known as the six-lobed alloneuron, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it thrives in high-altitude, cool climates. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
